channel.title: .samba files
channel.description: Well this year at my 6th form they're running an engineering course for people and we all had to go for interviews and 4 of us got selected i was one of them. We have to solve an enginering problem in day to day life and then make a presentation about it at a unviersity somewhere maybe heartfordshire cant remember. Anyway we are working with the company taylor woodrow and they record some of their results from accoustic sound testing in a file format called .samba which is made by the Samba application. I will be able to provide you a link when to their website on thursday after have been back to the test site. Samba has an awful way of exporting its results, it exports them into an excel file that you cant even read. I was wondering if someone here could make an application that can open and display .samba files in a readable manner. And if possible be able to export it out in a pdf or doc file

item.title: .samba files
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ASCII exportation sounds rather nice (and easy to parse!!!)

Read full topic

item.title: .samba files
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Im working on the example steve is getting there but theres some legal mumbo jumbo he has to go through to be able to release to us the results

Read full topic

item.title: .samba files
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Data export to the following formats is already integrated: Noise & Vibration Works si++ Workbench MS Excel ASCII Universal File Format (UFF)
OK so we know it exports to excel...unfortunately there are like 6 different excel formats. Please, [quote="Miss Silabsoft, post:2, topic:241870"]Give us an example![/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: .samba files
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Todays thursday so i did get hold of SAMBA on a disk and this is the link that the application provides
http://www.sinusmess.de/e/produkte/samurai.htm
This relates mainly to samurai but if you hit ctrl + f you can find out bout SAMBA down at the bottom, its funny how they have things called tango and boogie. Lol dancers obviously own this company

Read full topic

item.title: .samba files
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Like Unhandled, the only ‘samba’ I have heard of is about software for windows networks.

It’s a dance actually

Read full topic

item.title: .samba files
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Im not sure if it is a well known application, but the engineering company Taylor woodrow use it for their accoustic sound test, it reads db’s and Hz(MHz) on a graph and then puts it into a report i will get a link from the application on thursday once i receive a copy of it

Read full topic
